intro: Capnoides fabacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its stems are often covered in a soft, velvety hair, giving it its common name. Capnoides fabacea is typically found in wetlands, swamps, and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soil.
